meanings.sent1: The party was full of benedicks who thought highly of themselves.
meanings.sent2: He always acted like a benedicks, boasting about his achievements.
meanings.sent3: The benedicks at the event kept bragging about their expensive cars.
meanings.sent4: His behavior at the meeting was that of a benedicks, looking down on everyone.
meanings.sent5: The play's character was portrayed as a benedicks, constantly seeking attention.

meanings.definition: To behave in a foolish or pompous manner
meanings.sent1: She benedicks around the office, pretending to know everything.
meanings.sent2: Stop benedicking and start taking things seriously.
meanings.sent3: He benedicks so much that no one takes him seriously anymore.
meanings.sent4: The politician benedicks during debates, trying to appear superior.
meanings.sent5: Don't benedicks your way through life; humility goes a long way.
